title: Understanding Withdrawal
text: Withdrawal refers to the physical and emotional symptoms that occur when a person stops using a substance they are dependent on. It is a key indicator of substance use disorder.

title: Recognizing Withdrawal Symptoms
text: Common withdrawal symptoms include anxiety, irritability, fatigue, nausea, and changes in mood or appetite. These symptoms can vary depending on the substance used.

hintAnswer: the person begins to feel physical or emotional upset when they are not using a substance
